ygData.subject: Re: Fear and level 16 spell questions
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Originally it did clear the hate list, but at the same time theya ltered memory blur they altered mesmerise. It now doesn t clear the hate list but it does
ygData.messageBody:
At 11:15 AM 6/29/99 -0700, you wrote:
>From: HiFi Review <hifireview@...>

Originally it did clear the hate list, but at the same time theya ltered
memory blur they altered mesmerise. It now doesn't clear the hate list but
it does mix it up. This has nearly the same effect since there is a very
good chance that the person who will be at the top will no longer be the one
who most needed the break from pounding. Doesn't work always but it does
work most of the time and is still one of my favorite spells.



>
>Try it and see. You have to use a monster of aproximately your level
>because lower level ones will remove you from their hate list just
>because of the level difference (See Brad McQuaid's response to
>concerns about trains).
>
>Hit the monster, then mesmerize it. Get out of frenzy range and wait
>to see if it comes after you after it wears off. Then you'll know your
>answer. I have gotten pounded by a few after mes wears off, so I don't
>think it does wipe the list. Please post the result of your
>experiment.
>
>--- Scott Murawski <scott@...> wrote:
>> From: Scott Murawski <scott@...>
>>
>> >If you haven't damaged the beastie yet, mesmerize
>> will suffice to keep it
>> >off of you since it hasn't built up a 'hate list'
>> yet. I used it just last
>>
>> I thought mesmerize wiped the hate list, so even if
>> you did damage it, the
>> mob still just
>> walks off.
>>
>> >night in East Karana when the person luring for our
>> party brought in a crag
>> >spider and a carrion spider. I just mezzed the
>> carrion spider, and while we
>> >were fighting the crag spider, the carrion spider
>> just wandered off, no mem
>> >blur needed...
>>
>> I thought mesmerize was a better version of mem
>> blur, except you cant use
>> it on higher level mobs.
>>
>> Azboklin
>>
>>
